private_information: I can only pick up and place blocks whose labels are vowels (A, E, I, O, U).
I can only manipulate the block at the top of any stack.
I can move only one block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, and J is on the table.

private_information: I can only pick up and place blocks whose labels are consonants.
I can only manipulate the block at the top of any stack.
I can move only one block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, and J is on the table.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and must produce the final PDDL domain and problem for a planner.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a consolidated PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward that achieves the block rearrangement goal using the agents' capabilities.

public_information: There are ten uniquely labelled blocks: I, B, J, H, A, G, E, D, F, C.
Blocks are arranged in stacks on a table. Agents may only interact with the block at the top of a stack and only move one block at a time.
Initial stacks are as follows: stack1 bottom I then B then J then D on top, stack2 bottom H then A then E on top, stack3 bottom G then F on top, stack4 single block C on the table.
The goal is a single tall stack from bottom to top: J on the table, I on J, H on I, G on H, F on G, E on F, D on E, C on D, B on C, A on B.
Moves must respect agent-specific constraints: one agent manipulates vowel-labelled blocks only and the other manipulates consonant-labelled blocks.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the vowel agent. Provide a clear description of your local observations, the blocks you can legally manipulate (vowel labels), the preconditions and effects of your atomic move actions expressed in plain structured form, and any assumptions or limitations you observe. Do not emit a final combined PDDL domain or problem. Use the environment public information placeholder and your private information to produce your local model.
pddl.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information} This is your goal context: {agents->vowel_agent->goal} Provide your observations of the current top-of-stack blocks you can act on, list allowed move patterns for vowel blocks, and express preconditions and effects for those moves in a concise structured form suitable for later integration.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the consonant agent. Provide a clear description of your local observations, the blocks you can legally manipulate (consonant labels), the preconditions and effects of your atomic move actions expressed in plain structured form, and any assumptions or limitations you observe. Do not emit a final combined PDDL domain or problem. Use the environment public information placeholder and your private information to produce your local model.
pddl.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information} This is your goal context: {agents->consonant_agent->goal} Provide your observations of the current top-of-stack blocks you can act on, list allowed move patterns for consonant blocks, and express preconditions and effects for those moves in a concise structured form suitable for later integration.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert multi-agent planner and orchestrator. Integrate the partial models and observations from the agents and produce a single complete PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownward planner. Keep actions of the two agents distinct and annotated with which agent can perform them. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Ensure types, predicates, action schemas, objects, initial state and goal are consistent and sufficient for FastDownward. Resolve naming mismatches and document any modeling choices you make.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You receive the following contributions from the agents: vowel agent contribution: {partial_vowel_model} and consonant agent contribution: {partial_consonant_model} Your objective is to produce a consolidated PDDL domain and problem that achieves the global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Use the environment public information: {environment->public_information} Keep agent actions syntactically distinct by prefixing or annotating actions with the performing agent. Provide the PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>.
